title: Alcohol-Free Social Starters
excerpt: Simple scripts, drinks, and habits to enjoy nights out—minus the hangover.
contentHtml:
Going alcohol-free doesn’t mean staying home. Start with a simple script (e.g., “I’m taking a break—it feels great”), pick 1–2 go-to alcohol-free drinks, and pre-plan your exit time.

Quick Wins

  • Prep your line: “Sparkling water for me, thanks.”
  • Find 2 AF drinks you enjoy.
  • Set a leave time before you go out.

title: Creatine: Minimal-Ingredients Guide
excerpt: How to choose a clean creatine monohydrate and use it safely.
contentHtml: Look for creatine monohydrate only, no flavors or sweeteners. Typical dose: 3–5g daily with water or a meal.

title: Gut Health Starters
excerpt: Easy daily habits that support digestion without expensive stacks.
contentHtml: Focus on fiber (25–35g/day), hydration, slow eating, and consistent sleep. Add fermented foods 3–4x/week.

title: Low-Waste Shower Kit
excerpt: Minimal, recyclable, and refillable picks for your daily routine.
contentHtml: Swap plastic bottles for bar soap and refillable containers. Choose fragrance-free if you’re sensitive.

title: Non-Toxic Cookware Basics
excerpt: Understand stainless, cast iron, and ceramic—what to use and when.
contentHtml: Stick with stainless steel, cast iron, and high-quality ceramic. Avoid damaged non-stick coatings.

title: Omega-3 Fish Oil Guide
excerpt: How to pick a clean oil (or algae) and dose it correctly.
contentHtml: Look for IFOS-tested oils with clear EPA/DHA amounts. Many people do well with 1–2g/day combined EPA+DHA.

title: Healthy Desk: Posture Setup
excerpt: Chair height, screen distance, and easy movement breaks.
contentHtml: Wrists straight, elbows ~90°, top of monitor at eye level, and a 3–5 minute movement break every 30–45 minutes.

title: Sleep Better: Evening Routine
contentHtml: Dim lights, screens off or blue-light filters, warm shower, and a short stretch. Keep the room cool and dark.

title: Water Filters
excerpt: Pitcher vs. under-sink vs. whole-home—what’s right for you?
contentHtml: Check your local water report first, then match contaminants to a certified filter. Replace filters on schedule.
